About Me

A little about me...

BIO

Hello! I'm Bryan, and I create websites.

I am also the Web Developer & Data Coordinator at NACO (National Angel Capital Organization). I create all of NACO's web applications, manage and analyze national data on investment, and co-author the Annual Report on Canadian Angel Investing Activity.

I enjoy building applications from scratch and seeing how my work can make a positive impact on the lives of others. I work on the front end, the back end... all of the ends!

My code is DRY and modular and I am always pushing myself to improve. One of my favourite parts of working in web development is having the opportunity to continually learn new technologies and find fresh ways to tackle a problem.

I used to work as an Air Traffic Controller and Flight Service Specialist. I've learned to work very well under pressure.

Check out my full resume!

Full Stack Web Developer & Data Coordinator

NAV Canada

Air Traffic Controller / Flight Service Specialist
  • Utilized sharp judgment and effective problem solving to choose the highest priority items that required attention.
  • Worked at a rapid pace; multitasking, so as to input information into the EXCDS computer system while transmitting to aircraft and scanning for the next problem to be solved.
  • Communicated clearly and effectively so that there was no mistake as to the instructions being given and listened intently to ensure an accurate read-back.
  • Extensive use of memory to score consistently over 95% on all testing of aviation knowledge as well as for keeping track of a great deal of information while working.

Dependable IT

Technical Support Analyst
  • Assisted customers with the troubleshooting of a variety of technical issues related to television, phone and Internet.
  • Captured all relevant and necessary information needed to determine the nature of the problem.
  • Took action to resolve the issue in an efficient and logical manner using multitasking and offering clear and concise explanations to the customers.
